content.title: Anterior Tibial Artery Entrapment
content.description: Rare entrapment of anterior tibial artery at the level of the interosseous membrane.

clinical_features.mechanism: Compression by fibrous band or anomalous muscle at interosseous membrane
clinical_features.presentation: Anterior leg claudication, especially with exercise

diagnosis.dynamic_testing: Ankle/foot positional maneuvers during duplex or angiography

treatment.surgical: Division of compressing structure, arterial reconstruction if damaged

content.clinical_pearl: Consider when anterior compartment claudication exists with normal popliteal signals
content.statement: Anterior Tibial Artery Entrapment is a fundamental concept in Health-Sciences Medicine Surgery Vascular Pathology Rare-Syndromes that provides essential knowledge for understanding related topics and clinical/practical applications.

explanation.intuition: Understanding Anterior Tibial Artery Entrapment helps build foundational knowledge. The concept connects to broader principles in the field.
explanation.key_insight: The key aspects of Anterior Tibial Artery Entrapment include core principles, common applications, and integration with related concepts.
explanation.technical_details: Technical details involve specific mechanisms, measurements, and evidence-based applications of Anterior Tibial Artery Entrapment.

citations.source: UpToDate. (2024). Anterior Tibial Artery Entrapment. Wolters Kluwer.
Harrison's Principles of Internal Medicine, 21st ed. McGraw-Hill.
